articles.description: Watch live BBC One coverage and follow text and radio commentary as Scotland host England in the Six Nations at Murrayfield.
articles.title: Six Nations: Scotland v England - watch, listen & follow text

articles.description: Listen to BBC Radio 5 Live commentary as Manchester United face Fulham and follow live text from three other games in the Premier League, followed by Bournemouth facing Manchester City and Arsenal against Newcastle.
articles.title: Premier League: Build-up to six games with Man Utd, Man City & Arsenal in action

articles.description: Ireland move closer to completing back-to-back Six Nations Grand Slams with an unconvincing win over a spirited Wales side in Dublin.
articles.title: Ireland beat Wales to make it three wins in three

articles.description: Douglas Luiz scores twice as a scintillating attacking display earns Aston Villa all three points against Nottingham Forest at Villa Park.
articles.title: Luiz double helps Aston Villa beat Nottingham Forest

articles.description: England batter Joe Root says his reverse-scoop shot is not "careless" and he will "100%" play it again.
articles.title: Root not 'careless' and will '100%' play scoop again

articles.description: Georgi Sudakov is attracting interest from Europe's top clubs, but the reality of war in Ukraine still looms for the Shakhtar midfielder.
articles.title: Air strikes & explosions - a footballer & father in war

articles.description: LeBron James scores 30 points on his return for the Los Angeles Lakers at they win 123-118 at home to the San Antonio Spurs.
articles.title: NBA: LeBron James stars as Los Angeles Lakers beat Victor Wembanyama's San Antonio Spurs

articles.description: Red Bull put down a statement of intent with their new RB20 car in pre-season testing, so are they set to win a third successive constructors' championship or can they be stopped in 2024?
articles.title: F1 pre-season testing: Red Bull make statement in Bahrain, but can they be stopped in 2024?

articles.description: Liverpool will aim to stay on course for a quadruple in Sunday's Carabao Cup final, while Chelsea bid for their first domestic trophy in six years.
articles.title: 'We'll go for it' - Liverpool aim to complete first leg of quadruple

articles.description: Listen to Rangers v Hearts, watch Sportscene results, and follow live text updates of Saturday Scottish football action.
articles.title: Scottish Premiership: Leaders Rangers among 10 teams in action
